items.question: How to check SBI personal loan status?
items.answer: You can track your SBI personal loan status by contacting customer care or visiting the nearest branch.

items.question: How to contact SBI personal loan customer care?
items.answer:
You can contact SBI personal loan customer care number through the following ways: 

  • Call the 24x7 toll-free helpline numbers which are 1800 425 3800 and 1800 11 2211. 
  • You can also call the number 080-26599990 which is chargeable.

items.question: What are the different types of SBI personal loans offered to employees of corporates?
items.answer: Employees of corporates can apply for the Xpress Power Loan or the Xpress Credit Personal Loan, provided they meet the eligibility criteria. Keep in mind that you will need to have a salary account with the lender to apply for the Xpress Credit Personal Loan.

items.question: If I take a personal loan from SBI, when will my liability to the bank come to an end?
items.answer: Once the entire outstanding loan amount becomes zero, your liability for your SBI personal loan will be removed.

items.question: What are the options to repay my SBI Personal loan?
items.answer: You can repay your SBI Personal Loan via EMIs through the ECS facility or through Standing Instruction.

items.question: Can I prepay my SBI Personal Loan and will I need to pay any additional charge on the prepayment of this loan?
items.answer: Yes, you can prepay your SBI Personal Loan. The bank charges prepayment penalty for certain personal loan schemes. You can find out more about this charge when you apply for the loan.

items.question: What are the personal loan products offered by SBI?
items.answer: The 3 main types of SBI personal loan products include: SBI Xpress Power, SBI Xpress Credit Personal Loan, and SBI Pension Loan

items.question: What is the minimum loan amount for SBI loan for central and state government pensioners?
items.answer: The minimum loan amount for SBI loan for central and state government pensioners is Rs.25,000.

items.question: How can a personal loan borrower get in touch with SBI if he or she has any queries?
items.answer: A personal loan borrower can reach out to SBI for support by making use of any of the customer care number or email addresses. The customer can also write an email to the grievance cell of SBI or visit any SBI branch for assistance.

items.question: Could you tell me the general loan tenure for SBI personal loans?
items.answer: All SBI personal loans are typically provided for a period of up to 60 months.

items.question: What should be my income to secure a personal loan from State Bank of India?
items.answer: SBI offers personal loans to individuals with incomes as low as Rs.5,000. However, this amount might vary depending on the scheme applied for.

items.question: Do I need to have a guarantor to apply for the Xpress Credit Personal Loan from State Bank of India?
items.answer: No, the lender does not require you to have a guarantor. However, before applying for the loan, you should ensure that you meet the eligibility criteria specified by the lender.

items.question: Are there any special discounts for women borrowers who apply for a Syndicate Bank personal loan?

sections.title: About UCO Bank Personal Loan

elements.body:
Being one of the major and oldest banks of the country, UCO Bank or United Commercial Bank as it was formerly known. Apart from being a commercial bank providing loans and advances among their primary activities, meeting term loans and working capital required by all sectors from agricultural, large/medium and small sectors, to infrastructure, trade and service sectors. UCO Bank has a variety of loans specially design to suit your needs.

One of them is the UCO Bank Personal Loans or UCO Bank Cash as they refer to it, this loan can be taken up by an individual who requires a Personal Loan for fulfilling the needs and requirements of him and his family, like education, marriage, medical treatments etc.

sections.title: Why choose UCO Bank Personal Loan?

elements.body:
With our current financial situation in the Indian markets, the amount we save in fixed deposits, saving accounts etc., may not have the same value in the future. Having your liquid money locked up in investments restricts your ability to have enough to pay off or spend on things you need like paying off credit card bills, taking that much needed family vacation, remodelling of your home etc.

With the UCO Bank Personal Loan or UCO Bank Cash as it's known all this is possible. UCO Bank, offers you a personal loan without collateral security for an amount of up to Rs. 2 Lacs, and for loans above that will need to put up collateral for only 40% of the loan amount.

items.title: UCO Bank Personal Loan Interest Rate
items.body:
UCO Bank offers a host of personal loan schemes to eligible borrowers, with the interest varying according to the scheme. Benchmarks adopted by the bank help in computing this interest, with two benchmarks currently in use. While interest rates computed according to base rates have been used for a while, MCLR benchmarks were introduced recently, following RBI directives.

UCO Bank Marginal Cost of Funds Based Lending Rate (MCLR) (For new borrowers)

UCO Bank introduced MCLR based benchmarks following RBI directives, with these benchmarks offering a better picture of current financial conditions. Factors like CRR, repo rate, loan tenure, operating costs, etc. have a direct correlation with MCLR, with any change in these parameters having an impact on rates payable by a borrower. The table below highlights the rates applicable as of June 2016.

MCLR Benchmark Tenure (Period)Benchmark Rates (MCLR)
Overnight8.10%
1 month8.20%
3 months8.30%
6 months8.55%
1 year8.65%
2 years9.65%

Personal loan interest rates (MCLR)

As per RBI guidelines, all consumers who avail a loan after April 1, 2016 will automatically fall under the ambit of MCLR. UCO Bank can choose to add a certain spread over and above this benchmark, with the final interest generally varying from case to case. The loan amount, repayment tenure, repayment mode (salary account with/without check-off), borrower income, etc. can all play a role in computing the final interest rate.

UCO Bank Base and Prime Lending Rates (For existing borrowers)

The base and prime lending rates at UCO Bank are highlighted below.

Base Rate9.70% per annum, effective October 5, 2015
Prime Lending Rate14.25% per annum, effective October 5, 2015

UCO Bank personal loan interest rate (Base Rate)

The date of loan approval plays a key role in determining the benchmark one falls under, with all borrowers who availed a loan before MCLR benchmarks were introduced having an option to choose their interest mode. They can either continue paying interest determined by factoring the base rate or move to MCLR. Those who refrain from migrating will pay an interest according to the loan scheme, with rates typically ranging between 12% per annum and 16% per annum. This is computed by adding a spread over the base rate, with it possible for one to avail preferential rates based on their relationship with the bank.

Note: UCO Bank reserves the right to change the aforementioned interest rates at its own discretion. All rates mentioned above are effective as of June 2016. Individuals looking to avail a loan from the bank are advised to check rates prevailing at the time of application.

Find more details about UCO Personal Loan Interest rates

items.question: Can I check my UCO Bank Personal Loan status?
items.answer: If you have applied through for your UCO Bank Personal Loan then all you need to do is login and check your status in real-time. If not you can contact the UCO Bank at their business hours and provide them with the application number and the credential they require and wait for their update.

items.question: What will be my maximum EMI for a month?
items.answer: EMI for a salaried individual can't exceed 40% of his/her take home salary, for someone who is self-employed the value of the loan is determined by the profits earned.

items.question: Where can I apply for a UCO Bank Personal Loan?
items.answer: You can find the application for the loan at the branch.

items.question: Is there any processing charges for applying for the UCO Bank Personal Loan?
items.answer: There is a 1% charge the minimum of Rs. 750/-

items.question: What are the different kinds of personal loans offered by UCO Bank?
items.answer: UCO Bank offers many different personal loans depending upon the reason for which the borrower requires the funds. For instance, the UCO Shopper Loan Scheme can be availed by individuals who require money to make purchases of household articles and consumer durables such as electronic gadgets, air conditioner, refrigerator, computer, television, etc. A top-up home loan can be availed by existing home loan customers to meet expenses related to children's education, furnishing, repairs and renovation of their home, agricultural purposes, business needs, etc. The UCO Car Loan Scheme can be availed by individuals who wish to purchase a motor vehicle. The UCO CA Loan Scheme is available to chartered accounts who require funds to construct / acquire office premises or finance cost of construction and land, finance cost of fixture, furniture and fittings of computers and other office equipment. The UCO Cash Scheme can be availed by individuals who require funds to meet unforeseen domestic expenses such as social obligations, education, marriage, etc.

items.question: What documents must I submit when applying for a personal loan from UCO Bank?
items.answer: The documentation process for a personal loan from UCO Bank is fairly simple, and the documents accepted by the bank include passports, driver's license, and Aadhar card for proof of identity. For proof of address, the documents accepted by the bank include telephone or electricity bills. Even a driver's license with a mention of the customer's current address is accepted. Payslips can be submitted as income proof.

items.question: What factors are taken into consideration by the bank when checking my eligibility for a personal loan?
items.answer: After you have submitted your loan application along with the necessary documents, the bank will run a verification check to ascertain your eligibility for the loan. Your job status, job security, monthly income, outstanding debt, credit score, ability to repay and a few other factors will be considered to ensure that you're a risk-free customer.

items.question: Can I avail a personal loan despite having a poor credit score?
items.answer: The bank will require you to have a good credit score before it sanctions any loan to you. However, you can take certain steps to increase your credit rating. Make sure that your ratio of secured loans to unsecured loans is good as the bank will consider you more responsible in this case. You must also make sure that you don't make loan applications with too many banks as it can reduce your credit score. Your job status also plays a crucial role. Make sure that you don't change jobs frequently as steady jobs and regular income are instrumental in the approval of a personal loan. The bank will only consider customers who have a steady job and are certain to draw an income that will help them clear their personal loan.

Guwahati is the capital of the northeast Indian state known as Assam. It is a peaceful city with rivers and hills around it. It is a transit halt for millions of people who visit different places in the northeastern parts of the nation. It is a leading port city that has been witnessing extensive progress over the past few years.

If you are in need of a personal loan for any of your needs in the city of Guwahati, you can conveniently apply for one on the Internet or by going to your lender's branch located in the city. When you apply online, you can complete the entire application process on your own without any professional assistance. On the other hand, when you visit a branch, you will most likely have to take help from a branch executive to complete the full process.

sections.title: How do I get a Personal Loan with the Lowest Interest Rate in Guwahati?

elements.body:
• Compare loans: If you really want to get a low rate of interest for your personal loan, ensure that you push yourself to compare multiple personal loan options. You need to check out the rates, fees, and other charges, and pick the most affordable loan. This can be done online with the help of your smartphone, laptop, or computer. All you need to do is check out the brochures of loan products on lenders' websites or visit third-party financial websites to compare and contrast interest rates.
  • Maintain a decent credit score: After you finalise on a loan and decide to approach a lender, you need to take care of one step to proceed further. You must make sure that your credit score is maintained well. This score is given by credit bureau agencies depending on your credit behaviour. The score should ideally be 750 or above. In case your credit score is low at the time of applying for a particular personal loan, your chances of getting your loan approved will be pretty low. Hence, if you have a pretty poor score, put in that little extra effort to boost it by being properly financially disciplined. You can then apply for a loan for a better result.
  • Job status: Your lender may actually do a background check of your job details to make sure that you have a steady source of income. You can also provide a proof of your income and proof of employment to show how much you are earning. This can be done by showing your most recent payslips, bank statements, offer letter, relieving letter, etc. Moreover, if your lender has collaborated with any of your employers, you may get preferential or special rates of interest for your personal loan.

sections.title: Salary requirements to avail Personal Loans in Guwahati

elements.body:
In order to be able to apply for a personal loan in the city of Guwahati, you will be required to meet a few basic eligibility criteria. This typically includes age criteria, income criteria, and repayment ability criteria.

You should be at least 21 years and not more than 60 or 65 years while applying for a personal loan. The age requirement will vary from lender to lender.

The salary requirements will also differ from lender to lender. However, you will definitely have to be earning a good salary on a monthly basis at the time of applying for a personal loan in this city. Ideally, you should be earning at least Rs.7,500 if you are a salaried employee. If you are a self-employed applicant, your business venture should be earning a profit of at least Rs.1 lakh p.a.

items.question: What is the maximum loan amount that will be offered by a lender in Guwahati?
items.answer: The maximum loan amount will depend on your lender. It will be determined by your repayment ability, credit history, and relationship with your lender.

items.question: How do I repay my personal loan in Guwahati?
items.answer: You can repay a personal loan in Guwahati or in any other city through various modes. This will also depend on your lender. The common modes of loan repayment include Standing Instruction (SI), Electronic Clearing Service (ECS), direct debit from your bank account, etc. You can choose any of these as per your convenience.

items.question: Do personal loans come with balance transfer options in Guwahati?
items.answer: Yes, you can select a balance transfer facility for your personal loan in case you want to shift the balances of your personal loan to another lender. You will have to check with your current lender and new lender regarding the terms and conditions for balance transfer.

items.question: In case my credit score is lower than 750, will I be able to procure a personal loan in Guwahati?
items.answer: While applying for a personal loan, even a credit score of 750 and above does not assure loan approval. This is very important to remember. When your credit score is lower than 750, you may have lower chances of getting your loan approved. Hence, if you really want that loan, you could put in a little extra effort to enhance your credit score. This can be achieved by being spending money in moderation. You could also present a security or collateral as it will reduce the risk of your lender. In case you got an increment in your salary, you can display your income proof to show that you can afford to repay the loan promptly. You may also combine your spouse's income to boost your loan eligibility.

items.question: Can I apply for a top-up facility with a personal loan in Guwahati?
items.answer: There are quite a few lenders in the city that provide top-up options for personal loans. You could check with your lender regarding the specifications of the top-up facility. Generally, you will have to complete paying EMIs at least for 12 months and only then you can avail the top-up facility.

elements.body: The American Express Platinum Travel Credit Card is an ideal credit card for frequent travellers. The credit card provides a wide range of travel benefits and privileges that will make your trips more interesting and rewarding. Let's explore the features and benefits offered by the card in detail.

sections.title: Features And Benefits Of American Express Platinum Travel Credit Card

elements.body:
American Express Platinum Travel Credit Card has plenty to offer to its cardholders.

  • Welcome bonus: Welcome gift includes 5,000 Milestone Bonus Membership Rewards Points redeemable for travel vouchers worth Rs.4,000.

The reward points will be credited only when the annual fee is paid and when the cumulative spends within the first 60 days of card issuance reach Rs.5,000.

  • Spend based rewards: On spends of Rs.1.90 lakh in a year, you can avail travel vouchers worth over Rs.7,700.

On spending Rs.4 lakh in a year, you can earn Taj Experiences Gift Cards worth Rs.10,000 from the Taj Hotels Palaces Resorts Safaris and additional travel vouchers worth more Rs.11,800.

  • Complimentary airport lounge access: You will get 4 complimentary airport lounge visits per year to 11 airport lounges in Mumbai, Bangalore, Delhi and 9 other cities in India. The maximum free visits are capped at one per quarter.
  • Free priority pass membership: Cardholders can avail free membership to the Priority Pass Program worth US$99. Accompanying guests to pay a usage fee of US$32 for every visit.
  • Dining offers: Through the American Express Selects Dining Programme, you can avail up to 20% discount at select premium restaurants, multi-cuisines and others.
  • Pay in EMI: You can convert any big purchase of Rs.5,000 and above in easy monthly instalments (EMI) through American Express Pay-in-parts facility.

The feature offers low-interest rates, paperless approval and zero foreclosure charges.

  • Zero fuel surcharge: Use the Amex Platinum Travel credit card at Hindustan Petroleum fuel stations and avail 0% fuel surcharge on transactions up to Rs.25,000. Fuel purchases above Rs.25,000 are eligible for a discounted fuel surcharge of 0.3%.
  • Add-on credit cards: You are eligible for 2 supplementary credit cards at no extra cost. The cards can be availed for immediate family members including spouse, parents, siblings and children of above 18 years of age.
  • Zero liability on lost card: In case of lost or stolen card, you are 0% liable for any fraudulent transactions that may happen on the card after reporting. Loss before reporting is limited to a maximum of Rs.1,000.
  • Rewards program: Earn 1 membership reward point on every Rs.50 spent on the card except on fuel, insurance, utility payments, and cash withdrawals.

Accrued reward points can be redeemed for travel vouchers or from over 600 redemption options.

sections.title: Eligibility To Apply For Amex Platinum Travel Credit Card

elements.body:
The eligibility criteria for the American Express Platinum Travel Credit Card is as follows. The applicant should be:

  • Minimum 18 years of age
  • Permanent resident of India
  • Have a savings or current account with any Indian or multinational bank
  • Either salaried or self-employed.
  • Have an annual income of Rs.6 lakh or above
  • Should have a good credit history
  • For self-employed, the firm should be in operation for more than 12 months

sections.title: Documents Required To Apply For Platinum Travel Credit Card

elements.body:
• KYC documents such as PAN, ID Proof and address proof
  • One recent photograph
  • Form 16/ Salary slip

faq.title: American Express Platinum Travel Card Faqs:

items.question: How do I know the credit limit of this card?
items.answer: The credit limit of the card will be mentioned in the welcome letter sent with your credit card. You can also check the credit limit on your credit card statements.

items.question: What are the travel benefits offered with this card?
items.answer: You get a complimentary Priority Pass membership with the American Express card and 4 complimentary visits to 11 airport lounges in India.

items.question: Does this card come with any lifestyle privileges?
items.answer: Yes, the card comes with numerous lifestyle privileges which include dining discounts, vouchers from the Taj Hotels Palaces Resorts Safaris.

elements.body: The State Bank of India offers the ELITE card for the people who travel frequently all over the country and the world. It is a travel and lifestyle credit card which offers a wide range of offers such as domestic and international lounge access, and discounts on an international and domestic flight and hotel bookings. Apart from this, the ELITE credit card has dining and entertainment offers as well.

Key Highlights of the SBI ELITE Credit Card Welcome Benefits
  • For every Rs.100 spent, earn 2 reward points.
Entertainment Benefits
  • Get free movie tickets worth Rs.6,000 every year.
  • This offer will be valid for a minimum of 2 tickets per booking per month.
Milestone Benefits
  • Earn up to 10,000 reward points on an annual expenditure of Rs.3 lakh and 4 lakhs.

    Add - Earn up to 15,000 reward points on annual spends.

Low Foreign Exchange Markup
  • The SBI ELITE credit card offers the lowest forex mark-up charge at 1.99% for international use.
Concierge Service
  • With this card, you are also entitled to exclusive assistance from the bank with travel bookings, holiday packages, movies and dining reservations.
Annual Fee Waiver
  • The annual fee is waived off if your annual expenditure is more than Rs.10 lakh.

sections.title: Benefits and Features of SBI ELITE Credit Card

elements.body:
Trident Privilege Membership
  • Enjoy a complimentary Trident Privilege Red Tier Membership.
  • On registration, get a welcome gift of 1,000 points.
  • Get 1,500 bonus points on your first stay at the hotel and an additional Rs.1,000 hotel credit on an extended overnight stay.
Fuel Surcharge Waiver
  • 1% fuel surcharge is waived off on transactions ranging from Rs.500 to Rs.4,000 at any petrol pump.
  • The maximum surcharge waived per credit card is Rs.250.
Domestic Airport Lounge Program
  • Benefit from the Domestic Lounge Program offered by the card.
  • Avail 2 complimentary domestic lounge visits every quarter in the country.
International Airport Lounge Program
  • With the credit card, complimentary membership to the Priority Pass Program is given.
  • Enjoy 6 complimentary international lounge visits per year. Maximum of 2 visits per quarter.
  • Get access to more than 1,000 airport lounges all over the world.
Club Vistara Membership
  • Get complimentary membership to Club Vistara Silver.
  • Get 1 free Lounge Access Voucher and 1 Upgrade Voucher.
  • With every Rs.100 spent, get 9 Club Vistara Points.
MasterCard / VISA Privileges
  • Save up to 10% on car rental bookings with Hertz and up to 35% on car rentals with Avis.
  • Earn up to 10,000 points per night on hotel stay on Kaligo.com along with 25% extra miles.
  • Get up to 50% off on gold games and 1 complimentary lesson per month with your credit card. Available at selected golf courses in India.
Fraud Liability Cover
  • Enjoy free Rs.1 lakh fraud liability cover on your card.
  • The cover is applicable from the period of 2 days prior to the reporting of loss till 7 days post reporting of loss.

sections.title: SBI ELITE Credit Card Limit

elements.body: The credit limit of the State Bank of India ELITE credit card is given at the discretion of the bank. There are several factors involved which are the credit history of the applicant, the credit report and score. Apart from this, the ongoing debts or loans of the applicant is a factor for deciding the card limit.

sections.title: Latest Offer Benefits of SBI ELITE Credit Card

elements.body:
Shopping offers
  • Enjoy a cashback of 5% on selected phones from the Vivo online store.
  • On a minimum transaction of Rs.2,500 and above, get 7.5% cashback at all Spencer's stores.
  • Apply the promo code SBI100 to get an Rs.3,000 discount at purchases made on Rentomojo.
  • Avail EMI mode of payment on purchases made on Myntra.com, Bodyshop.in, Amazon.in, Snapdeal.com, Flipkart.com, etc.
  • Get cashback of 5% on the purchase of Canon products at the store for a minimum purchase amount of Rs.35,000.
Dining Offers
  • Enjoy a discount of 20% every Monday and Tuesday on your food orders by applying the coupon code SBI200.
  • At selected restaurants on Nearbuy.com, get a cashback of 5% on a minimum transaction amount of Rs.1,500.
Travel Offers
  • Get a discount of Rs.1,000 on flight bookings made on EaseMyTrip.
  • Enjoy a discount of 20% on domestic and international hotel bookings on EaseMyTrip.
  • Avail a wide range of discounts on domestic and international flights on Travelxp.
  • Benefit from EMI mode of payments available on travel bookings on Cleartrip and Yatra.com.

sections.title: Reward Point Benefits of SBI ELITE credit card

elements.body:
• On dining, departmental store purchases and grocery spends, get 5X reward points.
  • For every Rs.100 spent on other purchases, earn 2 reward points.

sections.title: How To Redeem Reward Points?

elements.body:
Redeeming reward points can be done through net banking. To do so, here are the steps you need to follow:

  • Log in to your net banking account.
  • Select the option of 'redeem rewards' from the main page.
  • Your rewards will be shown on the left side of the page.
  • Choose the reward category from which you wish to redeem the points.
  • Add your city.
  • Input the quantity of the reward and then select 'add to cart'.
  • Check the disclaimer and then select the option of 'place order'.

sections.title: Eligibility of the SBI ELITE Credit Card

elements.body:
• You must be between the ages of 18-70 years.
  • The add-on cardholder must be above the age of 15 years.
  • The applicant must be a citizen of India.
  • A credit score of 750 or above is essential to be eligible for the card.

sections.title: Documents Required To Apply For The SBI Elite Credit Card

elements.body:
• Identity proof, which is PAN, driving license, Aadhaar Card, etc.
  • Proof of income such as the latest salary slips, Form 16, copy of IT returns, etc.
  • Filled application form.
  • A copy of Form 60 or PAN card.
  • Proof of residence which can be a Passport, Ration card, electricity bill, Aadhaar, etc.
  • Colored passport size photographs of the applicant.

The above-mentioned list of documents is indicative. It can be changed, or additional documents can be asked when you apply for the ELITE credit card.

sections.title: How To Apply For The SBI Elite Credit Card Online?

elements.body:
The primary method to apply for this card is through the website of State Bank of India.

However, you can also apply for a credit card through the website of BankBazaar. To do so, here are the steps which need to be followed:

  • Click on the option of 'Check Eligibility' to check if you are eligible for the card.
  • Add the information which is asked and submit it.
  • The portal will need a list of documents to be uploaded.
  • Once done, you can use the tracking ID under the option of 'Track Application'.

faq.title: FAQs on SBI Elite Credit Card:

items.question: What is the joining fee I should pay at the time of card issuance?
items.answer: You will be required to pay Rs.4,999 as the initial fee.

items.question: How much is the membership fee per annum? Can I get it waived off?
items.answer: The annual membership fee for SBI ELITE credit card is Rs.4,999. The annual fee is waived off if you spend Rs.10 lakh or more with the card for a year.

items.question: Explain the fraud liability cover that comes with this card.
items.answer: Cardholders are offered a fraud liability cover worth Rs.1 lakh. You will be required to report the loss within 48 hours. You will need to visit the website of the bank or call the SBI credit card customer care helpline.

items.question: What is the cash advance limit for SBI ELITE Card?
items.answer: The cash advance limit offered for this card is up to 80% of the total credit limit.

items.question: Can I apply for a supplementary card?
items.answer: Yes, you can avail various add-on cards on the Elite Credit Card. You can apply for a supplementary card online or by visiting the nearest branch.

items.question: Does this card have any green fees benefits?
items.answer: Yes, you can enjoy four free rounds of green fees access and up to 50% discounts on golf games. This comes with 1 free lesson every month at a few golf courses in the country.

items.question: Will the credit limit of this card automatically increase?
items.answer: Many credit card issuers will review accounts on a periodic basis and they will automatically increase the credit limit. However, you can always request for your credit limit for the credit card to be increased.

items.question: Is it good to increase my credit limit on an SBI Elite card?
items.answer: An increase in the credit limit can actually improve your credit score. This will give you more access to funds in case you have an emergency.

sections.title: Key Highlights of the Air India SBI Platinum Card

elements.body:
• As its name suggests, the Air India SBI Platinum Card has been designed to deliver premium benefits to frequent air travellers.
  • Travel bookings made on Air India are eligible for accelerated reward points.

sections.title: Travel benefits offered by the Air India SBI Platinum Card

elements.body:
• The card offers you a complimentary membership to the premium Air India Frequent Flyer Program - Flying Returns.
  • For every Rs.100 that you spend on booking air tickets on the Air India website, you earn up to 15 reward points.
  • It also offers complimentary access to lounges at domestic airports.

sections.title: Offers from BankBazaar on the Air India SBI Platinum Card

elements.body:
• You would love the paperless application process for the Air India SBI Platinum Card offered by BankBazaar.
  • You may check your credit score without paying anything for it on BankBazaar.

sections.title: Air India SBI Platinum Card Features and Benefits

elements.body:
Welcome rewards

  • You can bag a welcome gift of 5,000 SBI reward points while signing up for the card. The reward points will be credited within 15 days of joining/annual fee payment.
  • You also get free membership to the Air India Frequent Flyer Program - Flying Returns as a joining benefit.

Milestone Reward points

  • You can earn up to 15,000 bonus points on achieving milestone annual spends.
  • For annual spends of Rs.2 lakh, you earn 5,000 reward points and for spends above Rs.3 lakh, you earn 10,000 reward points. Thus, the cumulative bonus reward points earned is 15,000.

Renewal benefit: You earn 2,000 reward points every year when you pay the renewal fee for the card.

Reward points program

  • You earn 2 reward points on every Rs.100 spent on the card.
  • Every Rs.100 spent on Air India ticket booking (for self) will give you 15 reward points and 5 reward points (for others).
  • Reward points can be converted into Air India Air Miles which can be further redeemed for travel bookings made on Air India. 1 Reward point equals 1 Air India Air Mile.

Fuel surcharge waiver

  • You can avail 1% fuel surcharge waiver on all fuel transactions conducted using the card. The waiver is valid at all petrol pumps across India for transactions worth Rs.500 to Rs.4,000.
  • The maximum waiver that can be availed per billing cycle is Rs.250.

Complimentary lounge access:

  • With the Visa Lounge Access Program, you enjoy 8 complimentary visits to select domestic airport lounges. You can also enjoy access to lounges at over 600 international airports with the complimentary Priority Pass Program.

Balance transfer on EMI:

  • You can transfer the outstanding balance on your other bank credit cards to the SBI card and pay it back in EMIs. The balance transfer on EMI offered by SBI comes at a lesser interest rate and processing fee.

Flexipay:

  • The facility enables you to convert any big-ticket purchases made on the card into easy monthly instalments. Any purchase worth Rs.2,500 or above can be converted into EMIs and can be paid back in tenures ranging from 3 to 12 months.

Lost Card Liability Cover:

  • You also enjoy a lost card liability coverage of Rs.1 lakh with the Air India SBI Platinum Card.

Railway tickets bookings:

  • With the Air India SBI Platinum Card, you get the facility of booking railway tickets online and getting them delivered at your doorstep.

To be eligible for the Air India SBI Platinum Card,

sections.title: How to apply for the Air India SBI Platinum Card online?

You can apply for the Air India SBI Platinum Card online on the SBI credit card website.

Also, another option to apply for the Air India SBI Platinum Card is through BankBazaar website. This can be done through the following steps.

  • On the Air India SBI Platinum Card page on BankBazaar.com, select 'Check Eligibility' and complete the formalities.
  • Next, you have to enter the required details followed by uploading of the documents. Click 'Submit' when it is done.

faq.title: FAQs on the Air India SBI Platinum Card

items.question: When I apply for Air India SBI Platinum Card, can I save my half-done application and continue later?
items.answer: Yes, you may. The SBI web page has that feature.

items.question: How can I retrieve my Air India SBI Platinum Card saved application?
items.answer: To retrieve your Air India SBI Platinum Card saved application, you can simply log in to the application page and click the retrieve option.

items.question: How do I use my Air India SBI Platinum Card for air miles?
items.answer: For converting the reward points on the Air India SBI Platinum Card to Air India Air Miles, call SBI Card helpline at 1860 180 1290 or 39020202. You require a minimum of 5,000 reward points for availing the redemption option. Air Mile redemption has to be in multiples of 5,000 and will be converted within 7 working days from the date of receiving the request.

sections.title: Jet Airways IndusInd Voyage Visa Credit Card Features and Benefits

elements.body:
This card comes with a wide range of travel benefits and rewards apt for the frequent travellers. Here are some of the features of Jet Airways IndusInd Voyage Visa Credit Card:

  • Welcome gift: You will get a complimentary membership to Jet Airways' Jet Privilege - Frequent flier program in Blue tier category. You will also get a promo code which can be used to waive off the base fare on domestic one-way tickets booked on Jet Airways website. Further, cardholders are entitled to bonus JPMiles that will be credited to JetPrivilege membership account.
  • Jet Airways benefits: Use promo code "JTINDS" to get 5% discount on base fare for domestic and international flight tickets booked online at jetairways.com and jetkonnect.com.
  • Reward points program:
  • You will earn 2 reward points as JPMiles for every Rs.100 spent on the card on weekdays (Mon - Fri) and 3 points on weekends.
  • Utility bill and insurance payments attract 2 JPMiles.
  • Transactions made on Jet Airways website will attract 4 reward points on weekdays and 6 reward points on weekends.
  • The maximum number of JPMiles earned in a year are capped at 50,000. You can earn additional miles by paying an uncapping annual fee of Rs.7,500.
  • JPMiles can be redeemed for flight ticket bookings on Jet Airways and to upgrade flight ticket class from Economy to Business, Business to First class.
  • Golf privileges: As a privileged card member you can avail complimentary golf games and lessons exclusively conducted at leading golf clubs in Bengaluru, Ahmedabad, Chennai, Hyderabad, Delhi, Pune and Mumbai.
  • Travel benefits:

    Complimentary membership to Priority Pass Program that provides access to more than 600 airport lounges across the globe. You need to pay only the usage fee of the lounge.

  • Travel Plus program provides special waivers on lounge usage charges outside India. You can avail the usage fee waiver up to 8 times in a year.
  • Travel insurance: ICICI Lombard General Insurance provides comprehensive travel insurance cover to all the Voyage Visa Credit Cardholders. The insurance cover includes lost baggage cover of Rs.1 lakh, delayed baggage cover worth Rs.25,000, lost or stolen passport cover worth Rs.50,000, loss of ticket cover worth Rs.25,000 and missed connection cover worth Rs.25,000.
  • Fuel surcharge waiver: You can free yourself from surcharge charged on petrol purchases at fuel stations across India with IndusInd Bank's surcharge waiver facility. The waiver is applicable on all the fuel transactions worth between Rs.400 and Rs.4,000.
  • Complimentary concierge services: Through 24x7 concierge services, the card provides a host of premium benefits such as pre-trip assistance, hotel reservation, flight booking, entertainment and sports booking, gift assistance, on-road repair service, emergency fuel supply, battery service, accident management, medical assistance, emergency towing assistance and others all with a single phone call. Cardholders can avail concierge services from anywhere in the world.
  • Zero liability on lost or stolen card: With 'Total Protect' program, IndusInd Bank provides complete protection against any unauthorised transactions that happen in case of loss or stolen card. The insurance covers up to 48 days prior to loss reporting.
  • Personal air accident insurance: Cardholders will get personal air accident cover worth Rs.25 lakh completely free with the card.

sections.title: How to apply for Jet Airways Voyage Visa Card from IndusInd Bank?

elements.body:
You can apply for Jet Airways Voyage Visa Credit Card directly from IndusInd Bank's official website. Follow the instructions mentioned below to apply for the card online.

  • Visit www.indusind.com
  • From the menu choose Personal > I'm interested in > Cards > Credit Cards
  • You will be redirected to IndusInd Bank credit cards page on which you can find 'Jet Airways Voyage Visa Credit Card' by scrolling down
  • Click on the card name to find the features and benefits of the card in detail. You can also compare the card with other credit cards offered by the bank using the 'Add to Compare' option on the page
  • Once done, click on 'Apply Now' button to apply for the card
  • Enter required details such as your current location, date of birth, employment details and others and click on 'Submit'
  • Your interest to apply for the card is then submitted to the bank. Once the bank receives the application, it will approach you on your mobile or e-mail. It will initially check your eligibility to apply for the card and if found eligible will inform you about the next steps in the application process.
  • Alternatively, you can also apply through Bank Bazaar website. In BankBazaar homepage, visit the credit card section. You will have the option to explore all credit cards and also check the eligibility for each card. Once you have specified your requirements, BankBazaar's wizardry will make a list of card that suits your needs. You can select Apply and fill in your details to immediately apply for the card.

faq.title: FAQs Jet Airways IndusInd Voyage Visa Card:

items.question: Explain about the travel insurance that comes with Jet Airways Voyage Visa Card
items.answer: IndusInd Bank has tied up with ICICI Lombard to provide insurance cover against lost baggage, lost ticket, loss of passport and delayed baggage.

items.question: Do I get a fuel surcharge waiver when I use my card to make a fuel purchase?
items.answer: Yes. All cardholders are offered a fuel surcharge waiver of 1% for transactions above Rs.400 valid at any petrol station across India.

items.question: Tell me more about the Priority Pass travel program
items.answer: With priority pass travel program, cardholders can access over 600 airport lounges across the world. The membership fee for the program worth US$99 will be waived off. You just need to pay the usage fee to access any of the Priority Pass lounges located across the globe.

items.question: What should I do in the unfortunate event of loss or theft of my card?
items.answer: Contact the bank using the toll-free number or visit the nearest branch as soon as possible. Total Protect scheme will cover you against fraudulent transactions after you report the loss of the card.

items.question: Do I also have an air accident cover?
items.answer: Yes. All customers are offered a complimentary personal travel insurance cover of up to Rs.25 lakh.

sections.title: Key Highlights of HDFC Regalia Credit Card

elements.body:
• Spend Rs.5 lakh or more in an anniversary year and earn 10,000 reward points.
  • You can avail up to 15% discount on the bill every time you dine-out.
  • Earn rewards faster with your Regalia card.
  • Redeem your accrued points for attractive gifts and rewards available exclusively for Regalia cardholders.
  • Enjoy up to 50 days of interest-free period.
  • Enjoy a low foreign currency mark-up fee of 2% when you use your card overseas.

sections.title: Benefits and Features of HDFC Bank Regalia Credit Card

elements.body:
Travel Benefits

  • Complimentary airport lounge visits: With a complimentary Priority Pass membership, enjoy access to more than 1,000 airport lounges across the globe. The primary member along with the add-on credit cards will get 6 complimentary visits to lounges outside India in a calendar year.
  • Cardholders can also enjoy complimentary access to domestic airport lounges, through the Regalia Visa/MasterCard Credit Card Lounge program. The programme provides 12 free visits to domestic airport lounges in a calendar year.
  • Travel concierge services: HDFC Bank provides travel concierge assistance service to all its Regalia Credit Card users helping them to customise their travel experience.
  • Comprehensive air travel cover: Cardholders are eligible for air accident death cover of Rs.1 crore, emergency overseas hospitalisation cover of Rs.15 lakh and credit liability cover worth Rs.9 lakh.
  • Airport privileges: Enjoy priority check-in and waitlist clearance, additional baggage allowance and an option to earn 9 Club Vistara points on every Rs.100 spent on the card.

Note: Club Vistara Silver membership has been discontinued for Regalia cards issued from 20th March 2019. Existing cardholders can avail of this membership until expiry.

Fuel Benefits

  • Fuel surcharge waiver: Fuel surcharge is waived off on fuel transactions made on your card. Fuel transactions worth Rs.400 to Rs.5,000 are eligible for the waiver with a monthly surcharge waiver capped at Rs.500 per billing cycle.

Dining Benefits

  • Complimentary Zomato Gold membership: Enjoy Zomato Gold membership for 1 year at no charge with your card. Also, enjoy up to 2 drinks at no extra fee when you dine at participating restaurants.

Note: Zomato Gold membership is valid only for Regalia cards issued after 20 March 2019 and is limited to the primary cardholder.

sections.title: HDFC Regalia Credit Card Limit

elements.body:
The card limit is at the discretion of the bank and dependent on factors such as your credit score and credit history.

HDFC Regalia Reward Point Benefits

  • Earn 4 reward points on every Rs.150 you spend on your card.
  • Get 10,000 Reward Points on spending Rs.5 lakhs in a year.
  • Earn additional 5,000 Reward Points on annual spends of Rs.8 lakhs.

HDFC Regalia Reward Point Redemption

Reward points earned on your Regalia card expire within 2 years of accumulation. You can redeem your existing points by following the steps below:

  • Visit the dedicated HDFC Regalia portal (www.hdfcregalia.com) and choose from the list of redemption options.
  • Alternatively, you can also choose from the options listed under the 'SmartBuy' section on the HDFC Bank website or on NetBanking.
  • Select the voucher/reward and confirm your selection, after which the points stand redeemed.

sections.title: Fees and Charges of the HDFC Bank Regalia Credit Card

elements.body: Some of the fees and charges associated with your card can be found below:

cols.content: Rs.2,500 + taxes (waived if you spend Rs.3 lakh in one year)
2.5% of the amount or a minimum of Rs.500
2% of the payment amount subject to a minimum amount of Rs.450
2.5% of the amount or a minimum of Rs.500

sections.title: HDFC Regalia Credit Card Eligibility and Documentation

elements.body:
The eligibility criteria, as well as documents to be submitted, are listed below:

  • Salaried professionals should be aged 21 years and above but below 60 years. Income should be more than Rs.1.2lakh per month.
  • Self-employed applicants should be aged 21 years and above but below 65 years. Annual income should be more than Rs.12 lakh.
  • Income proof, address proof and identity proof documents are to be submitted as per the bank's request.

sections.title: Documents required to Apply for HDFC Regalia Credit Card are:

elements.body:
• Proof of Identity
    • Driving License
    • Passport
    • Aadhaar card
  • Address Proof
    • Passport
    • Ration Card
    • Voter ID
    • Aadhaar card
  • Income Proof
    • Salary Slip
    • IT Returns
    • Form 16

sections.title: How to Apply for HDFC Bank Regalia Credit Card Online

elements.body:
Apply for an HDFC Regalia credit card online by following the steps below:

  • Visit the HDFC Bank website and choose the 'Regalia' card.
  • Click on the 'Apply Online' button.
  • You will be redirected to an online form. Fill in the required details such as name, mobile number, e-mail ID, company name, monthly income, etc.
  • Click on 'Submit'.
  • Once HDFC receives your application, you will receive a phone call or SMS on your registered mobile number.

If you're eligible for the card, the application process will be informed to you over the call and the further procedure will follow.

faq.title: FAQs on HDFC Regalia Credit Card

items.question: How do I earn reward points on Regalia Credit Card?
items.answer: You can earn reward points by making transactions using your Regalia Credit Card. Only retail spends are eligible for the reward points. Fuel transactions and EasyEMI transactions are not eligible for reward points. The accrued reward points will have an expiry of 2 years before which they should be redeemed for various gifts available on the rewards catalogue.

items.question: Do I earn reward points for international flight bookings made using Regalia Credit Card?
items.answer: Yes, you earn reward points for all domestic and international airlines bookings.

items.question: Can I recharge my mobile on the Regalia online platform?
items.answer: Yes, you can access the HDFC Regalia online portal and recharge your prepaid mobile phone.

items.question: How can I make payments for the HDFC Regalia card?
items.answer: You can make payments for your credit card through multiple payment options like auto pay, funds transfer, Net Banking, mobile banking, etc.

items.question: I misplaced my Regalia credit card. What do I do?
items.answer: If you have misplaced/lost your card, simply call the HDFC Credit Card Customer Care division and notify them of the same. Your card will be blocked instantly. Alternatively, you can report a lost/stolen card through your NetBanking account.

sections.title: Benefits of Airline Credit Cards

elements.body:
For frequent travellers, having an airline credit card is like having a special privilege that provides various complimentary benefits throughout their trip. Exclusively designed for air travellers, airline credit cards come with many useful features and benefits including complimentary air miles, discounts at hotels, dining and others, free airport lounge visits, etc.

Let's have a look at the common benefits offered by airline credit cards.
  • Earn air miles: All the airline related transactions done using an airline credit card will earn air miles which can be redeemed for purchasing tickets on both domestic and international airlines.
  • Bonus miles: It could be as a welcome gift or a renewal gift, credit card issuers typically offer bonus miles within a few days of card issuance. The miles can be encashed in the form of airline tickets during your next travel.
  • Accelerated miles: What's more fun than earning more reward points. With the accelerated miles programme, some credit cards offer accelerated miles on certain transactions. Make sure you're aware of the transactions eligible for accelerated rewards to make the most of the programme.
  • Airport lounge access: Sit back and relax in the airport lounges in times of delayed flights with the complimentary lounge visits offered by airline credit cards. The access is limited to select airports in India and in abroad. Cardholders need to display their credit cards at the eligible airport lounges and can enjoy the refreshments, internet facility and amenities offered by the lounges.
  • Fuel surcharge waiver: Of the other benefits offered by airline credit cards, fuel surcharge waiver is something useful even for less frequent travellers. Every time, you purchase fuel using an airline credit card, the fuel surcharge, which is typically charged on all card transactions at fuel stations, will be waived. Cardholders can thus enjoy fuel savings using an airline credit card.

Citi PremierMiles Credit Card

This card is one of the most popular airline credit cards because it offers complimentary air travel. Citi PremierMiles Credit Card offers air miles, which cardholders can redeem for hotel bookings, car rentals and flight bookings. It also provides them with free access to selected airport lounges.

Fee Charges of Citi PremierMiles Credit Card:
  • Annual Fee - Rs.3,000. This fee is waived off for Citi Priority customers
  • Interest Rate - Between 37.2% p.a. and 42% p.a.
Features and Benefits of Citi PremierMiles Credit Card:
  • Cardholders will receive 10,000 Miles on their first spend. To earn these miles they have to spend a minimum of Rs.1,000 within 60 days from the date of issue of the airline credit card
  • Cardholders will receive 3,000 Miles on renewal
  • The card offers 10 Miles for every Rs.100 cardholders spend on any airline transactions and on spends made at any of the bank's online merchant partners. It offers 10 Miles for every Rs.100 that cardholders spend on the website of Premier Miles. The card offers 4 Miles for every Rs.100 they spend on other transactions. The Miles will never expire
  • Cardholders can redeem miles to book tickets of more than 100 airlines (domestic and international)
  • Cardholders can transfer their miles to the bank's airline and hotel partners. They will receive 1 Frequent Flyer Mile for every 2 Miles transferred to Delta Airlines, Cathay Pacific, British Airways, Malaysia Airline, Thai Airways, Singapore Airlines, Etihad Airways, Air India and Qatar Airways
  • Customers can apply for this airline credit card online
  • When Frequent Flyer Program (FFP) members of any airline book a ticket using this card, they will earn FFP Miles plus 10 Miles for every Rs.100 they spend on purchasing it

Air India SBI Signature Credit Card

This airline credit card is known for offering attractive benefits and features. Features and benefits of Air India SBI Signature Credit Card includes Reward Points, complimentary Priority Pass Program membership, lost card liability, balance transfer on EMI facility, Easy Bill Pay facility, etc.

Fee & Charges of SBI Air India Signature Credit Card
  • Annual Fee - Rs.4,999
  • Renewal Fee - Rs.4,999
Features and Benefits of SBI Air India Signature Credit Card:
  • Avail 20,000 reward points as welcome gift and 5,000 reward points as renewal gift.
  • Receive complimentary Air India Frequent Flyer Program membership
  • Earn 20 Reward Points on every Rs.100 that you spend on booking Air India flight tickets and 4 Reward Points on every Rs.100 that you spend using the card
  • Earn up to 1,00,000 bonus Reward Points in a year. 1 Reward Point is equal to 1 Air India air mile
  • Get Rs.1 Lakhs worth complimentary lost card liability cover
  • Enjoy fuel surcharge waiver of 2.5%
  • Get add-on cards for family members.
  • Convert transactions worth Rs.2,500 and above into EMI using Flexipay feature

Air India SBI Platinum Credit Card

This airline credit card upgrades your travel experience to a new level. The Air India SBI Platinum Credit Card has multiple features and benefits to offer like reward points, lost card liability, cash anywhere at any time, add-on cards, Easy Bill Pay facility, etc.

Fee & Charges of SBI Air India Platinum Credit Card
  • Annual Fee - Rs.1,499
  • Renewal Fee - Rs.1,499
Features and Benefits of SBI Air India Platinum Credit Card
  • Avail 5,000 reward points as welcome gift and 2,000 reward points as renewal gift
  • Receive complimentary Air India Frequent Flyer Program membership
  • Earn 10 Reward Points on every Rs.100 that you spend on booking Air India flight tickets and 2 Reward Points on every Rs.100 that you spend using the card. 1 Reward Point is equal to 1 Air India air mile
  • Enjoy fuel surcharge waiver of 2.5%
  • Get Rs.1 Lakhs worth complimentary lost card liability cover
  • Convert transactions worth Rs.2,500 and above into EMI using Flexi-pay feature
  • This card offers Balance Transfer facility on EMI

Axis Bank MY Wings Credit Card

The airline credit card offered by Axis Bank allows people to plan their travel smartly. Axis Bank MY Wings Credit Card is an EMV chip card that has special airline, road and railway offers for customers.

Fee & Charges of Axis Bank MY Wings Credit Card:
  • Joining Fee - Rs.1,200
  • Annual Fee for 1st year - Nil
  • Annual Fee from 2nd year - Rs.500
Features and Benefits of Axis Bank MY Wings Credit Card:
  • Avail 2 base fare free flights tickets and holiday and hotel vouchers worth Rs.10,000
  • It offers 4 points on every Rs.200 that cardholders spend using it. It offers 100 points on the first transaction
  • Cardholders can enjoy complimentary access at selected airport lounges
  • The airline credit card offers cashback on domestic flight ticket bookings, bus ticket bookings, car rentals and railway ticket bookings
  • Cardholders can convert transactions worth Rs.2,500 and above into EMI
  • Avail fuel surcharge waiver when you use this card at any fuel station in India

IndusInd Bank Jet Airways Voyage American Express Credit Card

IndusInd Bank and Jet Airways have partnered to make travel an amazing experience for the customers. Through IndusInd Bank Jet Airways Voyage American Express Credit Card, they provide attractive benefits and features to the customers when they use it to make purchases.

Features and Benefits of IndusInd Bank Jet Airways Voyage American Express Card
  • Earn 6 JPMiles on every Rs.100 that you spend on the Jet Airways website on weekdays and earn 8 JPMiles on weekends
  • Earn 3 JPMiles on every Rs.100 that you spend on other spends on weekdays and earn 4 JPMiles on weekends
  • Enjoy special entertainment offers such as free movie tickets
  • Enjoy special benefits from American Express such as American Express Connect, American Express ezeClick and American Express EPAY
  • Enjoy complimentary access to airport lounges

IndusInd Bank Jet Airways Voyage Visa Credit Card

IndusInd Bank and Jet Airways have partnered to make travel an amazing experience for the customers. Through IndusInd Bank Jet Airways Voyage Visa Credit Card, they provide attractive benefits and features to the customers when they use it to make purchases.

Features and Benefits:
  • Earn 4 JPMiles on every Rs.100 that you spend on the Jet Airways website on weekdays and earn 6 JPMiles on weekends
  • Earn 2 JPMiles on every Rs.100 that you spend on other spends on weekdays and earn 3 JPMiles on weekends
  • Enjoy special entertainment offers such as free movie tickets.
  • Enjoy special benefits from Visa

Standard Chartered Emirates World Credit Card

Standard Chartered Bank and Emirates have partnered to offer this airline credit card. Standard Chartered Emirates World Credit Card is popular for the multiple rewards it offers and cardholders can avail benefits on not just Emirates, but all its partner airlines as well.

Fee & Charges of Standard Chartered Emirates World Credit Card

Annual Fee - Rs.3,000

Features and Benefits of Standard Chartered Emirates World Credit Card
  • Avail 4,000 Skywards Miles when you enrol for this card and earn 4,000 Skywards miles when you pay the annual fee every year
  • Enjoy complimentary access to over 30 domestic airport lounges
  • Earn 4 Skywards Miles on every Rs.150 you spend within India and earn 6 Skywards Miles on every Rs.150 that you spend abroad
  • Avail 5% cashback on purchases that you make in duty free stores
  • Enjoy golf benefits such as complimentary access to courses and Starwood Gold membership
  • Avail 20% cashback (Maximum - Rs.600) every month on Uber rides
  • Avail up to Rs.10 Million worth air accident insurance coverage

sections.title: How To Apply For Airline Credit Cards Online?

elements.body:
Two channels through which one can apply for airline credit cards online include applying through bank's website and through authoritative third party platforms such as BankBazaar. Below instructions will help you know the online application process for airline credit cards.

Apply through bank's website: Many banks accept online application for airline credit cards. You can visit the bank's website and check for the availability of the feature. If you find 'Apply' button on the airline credit card page, you can follow the steps mentioned below to apply for the credit card.

Steps to apply for airline credit cards online

  • Visit the official website of the bank
  • Choose an airline credit card that matches your requirement
  • Click on 'Apply' button to visit the online application page
  • On the application page, enter all the required information in the designated fields
  • Double check the entered information before submitting the application.

On successful submission of the application, the system will generate an application reference number, which should be recorded for all future references.

Once the bank receives the application, it reviews the same and if your profile becomes eligible for the applied card, you will receive a call in 3-4 working days. The further application process will be informed to you over a phone call or through an e-mail.

Banks typically take 7-10 days to process a credit card application. If you have any queries meanwhile, you can use the application reference number to track your credit card application status online.

Apply through BankBazaar website: BankBazaar is an authorised third party financial service provider. By partnering with more than 50 banks, the company offers a comprehensive platform to shop, compare and apply for financial products including credit cards, all under one umbrella. If you're confused about choosing a credit card, you can visit the website, go through the various credit cards listed on the site, choose the one that suits your needs and apply for it on the same platform. Mentioned below is the process to apply for an airline credit card through BankBazaar.

Steps to apply for an airline credit card through BankBazaar
  • Go to bankbazaar.com
  • From the main menu, select 'Credit Cards'
  • The credit card page will display list of airline credit cards. You can choose one based on your travel needs
  • Beside the shortlisted card, you can find 'Check Eligibility' option. Click on the same and check your eligibility by providing the required details
  • If your profile is eligible for the chosen card, you will be taken to online application page, where you need to fill all the required details and click on 'Submit'
  • On successful submission of the application, the screen will display an 'Application ID', which should be retained for all future queries

BankBazaar also offers 'Track Application' feature through which you can check your credit card application status online.

sections.title: Eligibility For Airline Credit Cards

elements.body:
Each credit card issuer sets a different eligibility criteria based on the card and applicant type. Mentioned below is the basic eligibility required to apply for an airline credit card.

  • Applicant should be an Indian citizen
  • Salaried or self-employed professional or self-employed business-holder
  • Should have a decent credit history (Not applicable for first time borrowers)
  • Minimum age of the applicant should be 21 years and maximum age is 60 years

sections.title: Documents Required To Apply For Airline Credit Cards

elements.body:
The required documents to apply for an airline credit card varies from one bank to another. Some basic documents required by many banks are mentioned below.

  • Copy of identity proof such as Aadhaar card, passport, etc.
  • Copy of PAN card
  • Two months salary slips or IT Returns
  • Copy of address proof document such as Voter's ID, Aadhaar, driving licence, electricity bill, passport, etc., whichever holds your current address
  • 1 passport size photograph
  • Duly signed in application

sections.title: What Kind Of Rewards Points Can Be Earned On Airline Credit Cards?

elements.body:
Airline credit cards are much helpful for those who travel often and are globetrotters. These cards besides providing regular credit card benefits provide exclusive features related to air travel. Complimentary lounge access to both domestic and international airports, priority check-in, extra baggage allowance and lot more.

Another interesting feature offered by airline credit cards is the reward points programme. Unlike the reward points programme on regular credit card, the reward points offered on airline credit cards will be accrued in the form of air miles. Each airline offer different air miles. For Instance, Jet Airways offers JPMiles, SpiceJet offers AirMiles, etc. The accrued air miles can be redeemed for flight bookings, to transfer seats from economy class to business class, and lot more.

Earning more air miles is also easy on airline credit cards as the card issuer offers accelerated rewards on specific spends that could help the cardholder to earn more air miles in less time.

items.question: What is the annual fee of Citi PremierMiles Credit Card?
items.answer: The annual fee for Citi PremierMiles Credit Card is Rs.3,000.

items.question: Which airlines can I transfer my Flyer Miles to with Citi PremierMiles Credit Card?
items.answer: With Citi PremierMiles Credit Card, you can transfer your Flyer Miles to Cathay Pacific, Delta Airlines, Malaysia Airline, British Airways, Singapore Airlines, Thai Airways, Air India, Qatar Airways and also, Etihad Airways.

items.question: Is there any renewal fee I need to pay for SBI Air India Signature Credit Card?
items.answer: Yes, you have to pay a renewal fee of Rs.4,999 for the SBI Air India Signature Credit Card.

items.question: Do I get any fuel surcharge waiver with the SBI Air India Platinum Credit Card?
items.answer: Yes, you get a fuel surcharge waiver of 2.5%.

items.question: Is there any travel credit card where there is no renewal fee?
items.answer: Yes, you do not have to pay any renewal fee for the Axis Bank MY Wings Credit Card.

sections.title: What Is A Fuel Credit Card?

elements.body:
A Fuel Credit card is being offered by banks to customers in a bid to provide them with maximum benefit while purchasing fuel. Having this card enables those who constantly buy fuel for various purposes to lower the expenditure on fuel. Apart from that, it enables the users of Fuel Credit card to use it for other benefits with regards to lifestyle.

All About Fuel Credit Cards

sections.title: How To Apply For A Fuel Credit Card?

elements.body: An individual can apply for a Fuel Credit card by visiting the nearest branch of the bank from which he/she wants to avail the card or apply online. The applicant needs to fill the application form and provide the documents asked for to get himself/herself the Fuel Credit card and cut down on the fuel expenses.

sections.title: Who Are Eligible To Apply For A Fuel Credit Card?

elements.body:
The eligibility to apply for a fuel credit card seems to vary from bank to bank. However, some of the common eligibility norms that an applicant needs to fulfill are:

  • Need to have a good credit score.
  • Need to fulfill the minimum age and income bracket as prescribed by the bank.

sections.title: How To Choose The Best Fuel Credit Card?

cols.content: While choosing the best fuel credit card, the most important thing is to identify the pattern of payment. The individual must look for a card that offers fuel benefits as well as best interest rates.

The individual needs analyze his/her expenses and decide on the monthly budget that would be spent on fuel. This is quite important as availing a fuel credit card without analyzing this would not serve the purpose.

Considering the fees and charges associated with the fuel credit card that one intends to get also needs to be assessed prior to availing the card. If this is not done, the benefits and discounts that come with fuel credit cards may be negated by virtue of paying high fees and charges that are associated with the card.
Check the redemption process of the card
It is better to check the redemption process of the fuel credit card. It is better to get those cards which offer instant redemption of points.

sections.title: Benefits Of Fuel Credit Cards

elements.body:
With many banks and financial institutions offering credit cards, the benefits that come with Fuel Credit cards differ. Apart from lowering the expenses with regards to purchasing fuel, some other benefits that come with Fuel Credit cards are as follows:

  • Get Reward Points
  • Redemption of points earned
  • Eligible for Cashback
  • Eligible for Surcharge Waiver
  • Dining offers
  • BookMyShow Offer
  • Eligible for Turbo Points
  • Waiver of Annual Fees
  • Can make utility bill payments
  • Eligible for Telecom benefits
  • Concierge Service

elements.title: Also Know Fuel credit cards with Cashback offers
elements.body: Cashback is one of the attractive and rewarding offers provided on fuel credit cards. In the time of rising petrol and diesel prices, having one fuel credit card with cashback feature is a saviour. You can receive the hiked petrol or diesel price as cashback by using a fuel credit card with cashback feature. Fuel credit cards also offer fuel surcharge waiver and accelerated reward points on fuel purchase which can be exchanged for both rewards and fuel purchases. One fuel credit card multiple savings, isn't it sounds amazing? Of course, yes.

sections.title: Features Of Fuel Credit Cards

elements.body: Just like other credit cards, Fuel Credit cards also come with a lot of features. Some of the features that come with Fuel Credit cards which banks provide are as follows:

cols.content: 5% cashback on fuel purchases. No minimum transaction required but the maximum cashback is capped at Rs.150 per month.
5% cashback on fuel purchases. No minimum transaction required but the maximum cashback is capped at Rs.150 per month.
ICICI Bank HPCL Coral Amex credit card
2.5% cashback on fuel purchases made at Hindustan Petrol pumps. The minimum transaction value should be Rs.500 and maximum cashback is capped at Rs.100 per month.
2.5% cashback on fuel purchases made at Hindustan Petrol pumps. The minimum transaction value should be Rs.500 and maximum cashback is capped at Rs.100 per month.
2.5% cashback on fuel purchases made at Hindustan Petrol pumps. The minimum transaction value should be Rs.500 and maximum cashback is capped at Rs.100 per month.
5% cashback on fuel spends at all petrol pumps. The minimum transaction should be Rs.750 and maximum discount is capped at Rs.250 per month

sections.title: Why Opt For A Fuel Credit Card?

elements.body: When most credit cards that are existing in the market offer fuel benefits to individuals, the question emerges as to why one should opt for a Fuel Credit card. The answer to this question is that Fuel Credit cards are specially designed to save money every time an individual refills his vehicle with fuel. With petrol and diesel prices on the rise, Fuel Credit card can enable an individual to cut down on the expenses that go into buying fuel.

sections.title: Factors to Consider While Selecting the Best Fuel Credit Card:

cols.content: When you look for a fuel credit card, you should see how much you will end up saving on your fuel transactions.

This is one of the most important things that you should look at when you are looking for a fuel credit card. You should check if the benefits are offered at particular petrol pumps owned by a certain Oil Company or at all the petrol pumps across the country.
Figure out if you will receive fuel surcharge waiver on your fuel spends or not.
Make sure the spend limit to avail benefits is not very high.
Check the annual fee of the credit card that you plan to purchase. Some cards offer you an annual fee waiver when you spend a certain amount of money using your card in a year.
Check out the redemption process of the credit card you plan to purchase. See if it offers instant redemption or not. Most cards offer instant redemption of points at petrol pumps.

items.question: Can I pay for fuel using my credit card?
items.answer: Yes, use your credit card like your debit card and you have to charge only what you can pay at the end of the month. You will not want to pay an extra 20% in interest for petrol.

items.question: How can I get a fuel card?
items.answer: You will have to apply for a Fuel Credit card by visiting your bank branch from which you want to avail a card. You will have to fill the application form and then give documents required for verification.

items.question: What is a petrol card and how can I use it?
items.answer: A fuel card is a payment card which can be used for the purchase of petrol and diesel at pumps.

items.question: Should I get a fuel card?
items.answer: A fuel card can be used for expenses and maintenance of vehicles. This card will come in handy as they allow you to manage and regulate your fuel expenses which are incurred, and you can stay informed about your business and personal related expenses.

items.question: What cashback offers are there for the IndianOil Axis Bank Credit Card?
items.answer: You can get 100% cashback up to Rs.250 on your all fuel transactions with the IndianOil Axis Bank Credit Card.

items.question: What credit card offers fuel benefits at Hindustan Petrol pumps?
items.answer: ICICI Bank HPCL Coral Amex credit card, ICICI Bank HPCL Coral Visa/MasterCard, and ICICI Bank HPCL Platinum Credit Card offers fuel benefits at all Hindustan Petrol pumps in the country.

items.question: Is there an eligibility criterion to apply for a fuel credit card?
items.answer: The primary eligibility criteria to apply for the card is that the applicant must be a citizen of India and must be above the age of 18. Along with this, the credit score of the applicant plays a major role and should have a stable income.

items.question: What are the factors to consider before opting for a fuel credit card?
items.answer:
The factors to be considered are:

  • Surcharge waiver
  • Credit limit
  • Annual fee

sections.title: Differences Between Premium And Non-premium (Regular) Credit Cards

elements.body:
Premium credit cards are loaded with certain types of features and benefits which separate them from the regular credit cards. The premium benefits in these cards also mean that the fees and charges for some of them might be higher than those of the regular cards.

If you are wondering about how to distinguish a premium card from a non-premium one, the following section would help you in your attempt.

Fees and charges:

The associated fees and charges are generally higher for the premium cards as compared to those of the regular ones. These include the joining fee, the renewal (annual) fee, etc.

Eligibility criteria:

  • In addition to the other criteria, to be eligible for the premium credit cards, you need to have a relatively high annual income which is above Rs.50,000 for most such cards.
  • On the other hand, there are regular cards which have an income criterion of as low as Rs.12,000 per month.

Joining bonus:

  • Most premium cards offer attractive joining bonus offers like reward points in bulk, complimentary air tickets, air miles, etc.
  • The regular credit cards either don't offer any joining bonus and even if some of them do, it's not very rewarding.

Reward points:

  • One primary advantage of premium cards is the privilege of a highly beneficial reward points program. You can earn points by using the card on multiple lifestyle and other categories.

Also, the accelerated reward points program in these cards allow you to earn RP in bulk which can be redeemed for premium products and services.

  • Although the regular cards also offer regular reward points and (a few of them even have accelerated programs), these are not as attractive as the ones offered by the premium cards.

Here, the reward points earned are low and the redemption options are also moderate.

Concierge services:

  • Most premium cards offer the special services of a dedicated concierge who would take care of all your travel bookings, hotel reservations, entertainment booking arrangement, and other such handy services.
  • But you are unlikely to enjoy these services in a regular credit card.

Lounge access:

  • With premium cards, you get complimentary and paid access to international and domestic airport/railway lounges through international programs like the Priority Pass membership.
  • For the regular cards, even if they offer lounge access, the number of visits would be fewer than the ones offered by the primary cards. Also, it would only be for domestic lounges and not the international ones.

Golf programs:

  • If you want to enjoy free golf sessions and lessons at domestic and international golf courses, you need to opt for premium credit cards.
  • This facility is hardly offered by any of the regular credit cards.

Milestone bonus:

  • For premium cards, if the annual spends on the card cross a certain amount as specified by the issuer, you get a certain large number of reward points as a bonus.
  • Although the milestone bonus exists in regular cards too, the quantity of reward points is not that high.

sections.title: Factors affecting Axis Bank Car Loan eligibility

elements.body:
Some of the factors that affect Axis Bank Car Loan eligibility are given below:

  • Income: You will have to earn a minimum salary on a monthly basis in order to be eligible for the car loan scheme offered by Axis Bank. Higher your income, better are your chances of availing a car loan from Axis Bank.
  • Market fluctuation: Fluctuation in market also determines the interest rate that will be charged on your loan amount. The rate of interest may be higher if the inflation is high, and similarly can be lower if the inflation rate is lower. Hence, always check how the market is performing before availing a car loan.
  • Loan amount: The loan amount will determine the rate of interest levied. Higher the loan amount, higher will be the rate of interest.
  • Repayment tenure: The repayment tenure plays a role in the lender determining the rate of interest charged on the loan amount. Higher the repayment tenure, higher will be the interest rate charged and vice versa.
  • Income-to-debt ratio: The lender checks the income-to-debt ratio before deciding whether they should approve your car loan or not. The income-to-debt ratio is nothing but the ratio of your income to the debt you own. Hence, in order to avail a car loan at a lower interest rate, you must ensure that your income-to-debt ratio is low.
  • Relationship with your bank: Your relationship with the lender will also determine the rate of interest levied on the loan amount. It is always recommended that the applicant avails a car loan from the bank where he/she holds a bank account. The bank finds it easier to provide loan to a person who has been a customer of the bank for a very long time. Hence, there is a very good chance that the applicant will get a car loan at a lower interest rate.

sections.title: Car Loan Schemes offered by Axis Bank

elements.body:
The car loan schemes offered by Axis Bank are:

  • Axis Bank New Car Loan scheme: This scheme is suitable for those who wish to purchase a new car for themselves. The minimum loan amount that an individual can avail is Rs.1 lakh with the repayment tenure being up to 8 years.
  • Axis Bank Pre-Owned Car Loan scheme: Customers who wish to purchase a pre-owned car for themselves can avail this car loan from Axis Bank. The minimum loan amount that one can avail is Rs.1 lakh with the repayment tenure going up to 5 years.
  • Loan against car scheme: If you are in an urgent need of money, you can avail this scheme where you can offer your vehicle as a collateral in exchange for loan. The loan amount offered by the lender starts at Rs.10 lakh and up to 50% of the original value of the car.

sections.title: How to Calculate EMI on Axis Car Loan

elements.body:
Before you avail a car loan from Axis, you may want to know how much amount you will be paying towards the loan each month. This is simply known as EMIs or equated monthly instalments and it offers an easy way to repay your car loan. By calculating the Axis Bank Car Loan EMI , you will be able to budget your monthly expenses better.

You can calculate the EMI for your car loan by using the below-given formula:

E = P*r*[(1+r) ^n/((1+r) ^n-1)]

In the above formula, E denotes the EMI, P the principal amount, r the interest rate and n the number of years or tenure of the loan.

You can also calculate the EMI by using the EMI Calculator tool wherein you just need to enter the loan amount, interest rate, repayment tenure, processing fee, etc. The tool will calculate the EMI and display it to you.
