sections.title: Syndicate Bank IFSC Code:

elements.body:
Each branch of bank in India has a specific IFSC code assigned to it in order to identify transactions done through that branch. IFSC codes are alphanumeric, unique codes. One can transfer funds to a branch of their choice by entering the IFSC codes or MICR codes of that branch. The usage of these codes are mandatory for online transactions of all the banks in India. The IFSC code ensures that there is no confusion when one transfers funds.

IFSC code consists of 11 characters. It encompasses three parts: the first four characters are alphabets and represent the name of the bank. This is followed by the digit ‘0’. The final six characters are usually numbers and indicate a particular branch.

For example, here is a breakup of the IFSC code of Syndicate Bank.

SYNB0009149 - IFSC Code for a Syndicate Bank

  • First four alphabets - SYNB – indicates the name of the bank (in this case Syndicate Bank)
  • 0 - For future use
  • 009149 - Indicates a particular branch of Syndicate Branch

sections.title: How to Search for Syndicate Bank IFSC and MICR codes?

elements.body:
Anyone can find out the IFSC codes and MICR codes of a bank if they know the full name of the bank and the branch that they are looking for. For example, if one needs the IFSC code of a
particular branch of Syndicate Bank, they can find it printed on a cheque books/leaves issued by Syndicate Bank. The complete list of IFSC codes of all the banks in India are offered by The Reserve Bank of India. Alternatively, you can log on to the official website of the bank to find the IFSC code. It is also possible to log on to a third party financial websites such as BankBazaar to find this information.

By logging on to BankBazaar, you will be presented with a complete list of IFSC codes for almost every bank in India, including that of Syndicate Bank. Following are the steps you should follow to get the IFSC or MICR codes that you require:

  1. Visit the BankBazaar website, scroll down the homepage, find the ‘Bank IFSC Code’ tab and click on it.
  2. This will open a second page where there will be a few drops down menus from which you will have to choose the ones that you are looking for.
  3. There will be a ‘Select Bank’ drop down options which will show you a list of banks that you can choose from. You must click on ‘Syndicate Bank’, followed by the appropriate option for ‘Select State’, ‘Select District’ and ‘Select Branch’. BankBazaar will generate the codes as soon as you select the mentioned information.
  4. You can also choose to browse through the list of banks which are provided on the same page and find the bank manually to get the IFSC code.

The generated table will not only provide you with the IFSC code but also the phone number, address of the branch, name, branch code etc.

items.title: How to Transfer Money using Syndicate Bank NEFT and RTGS?
items.body:
As a customer of Syndicate Bank, it is a simple and convenient task to make online fund transfers using NEFT or RTGS services.

National Electronic Funds Transfer (NEFT):

When you transfer funds using NEFT or National Electronic Funds Transfers, the process works based on Deferred Net Settlements. It is done on an hourly schedule which means that they are done in batches. If you have debited the amount within the time-frame that is stipulated by the bank, it will be credited to the beneficiary on the same day. If not, the amount will be credited on the following working day.

You will need the following information to use NEFT service at Syndicate Bank:

  • The name of the receiver
  • The name of the receiver’s bank and branch
  • The receiver’s account number
  • The IFSC code of the receiver’s bank branch
  • The amount to be transferred

Following are the Service Charges on NEFT transactions at Syndicate Bank:

RangeTransaction Charge
Upto Rs.1 lakhNIL
Rs. 1 lakh to Rs 2 lakh

Rs. 15 /- per transaction + ‘applicable taxes’

above Rs 2 lakh

Rs. 25/- per transaction + ‘applicable taxes’

Real Time Gross Settlement System (RTGS):

Real Time Gross Settlement System (RTGS), unlike NEFT, involves transfers being completed on an individual transaction basis which means that the clearance of funds are scheduled individually and not batch-wise. If you are looking for the quickest way to transfer funds, RTGS may be the perfect option. Not only is it one of the quickest modes of fund transfer, but it is also one of the safest. Syndicate bank ensures that all your transactions will be completed on the same day that the customer debits the fund, unless it has been done after the indicated time frame.

You will need the following information to use RTGS service at Syndicate Bank:

  • The receiver’s name
  • The receiver’s bank and branch name
  • IFSC Code of the receiver’s bank
  • The transfer amount
  • The receiver’s account number
  • A remark for the receiver, if any

The following are the charges for availing the RTGS service (for outward transactions) at Syndicate Bank:

RangeTransaction Charge
Rs. 2 lakh to Rs.5 lakh

Rs. 25/- per transaction + ‘applicable taxes

Rs. 5 lakh and above

Rs. 50/- per transaction + ‘applicable taxes

items.title: About Syndicate Bank:
items.body: Headquartered in Manipal, Karnatake, Syndicate Bank is one of the oldest commercial banks in India. T M A Pai, Upendra Pai and Vaman Kudva are the founders of this establishment. The first branch of the Syndicate bank began its operations in Udupi in 1925. The bank commenced with the aim of assisting local weavers financially, but soon grew to be much more. Initially, Synidicate Bank was known as Canara Industrial and Banking Syndicate Limited. The Government of India nationalized the bank in 1968. Today Syndicate Bank has over 3000 branches in all the States and Union Territories of the country. Its presence is also felt internationally.

items.title: Syndicate Bank is asked to file counter affidavits over an auction
items.body: Syndicate Bank has been asked to file counter-affidavits over a petition that was filed by Badhri Impex Pvt Ltd. The petitioner firm has filed a complaint against Syndicate Bank regarding a loan that was taken in 2014. Though the bank has granted time for the repayment of the loan, the petitioner firm says that the bank's officials have put the property for auction which is against the law. The court has asked Syndicate Bank for filing their counter-affidavits and has also adjourned the case till 30th of March.

items.title: 372 'Ananya' Branches Targeted for March by Syndicate Bank
items.body:
An initiative for business process re-engineering implemented by Syndicate Bank, Project Ananya, is expected to see the bank aim at transforming almost 10% of its branches by the end of March, 2017. The Executive Director of Syndicate Bank, Ch SS Mallikarjuna Rao revealed to the press in Mangalore that 372 branches are expected to be transformed as Ananya branches come the end of March. At the moment, there are already 200 branches transformed as Ananya branches. Rao went on to reveal that over the course of the coming financial year, 400 more branches are expected to undergo the transformation.

Project Ananya is an initiative that is aimed at transforming branches over two years so that customers can receive better service while the entire bank improves and takes a more modern approach.

items.title: Syndicate Bank launches Project Ananya at new Mumbai branch
items.body:
Syndicate Bank has opened a new branch at Nariman Point in Mumbai, where they will be implementing their flagship programme, Project Ananya. The branch is equipped to provide superior customer service through the latest digital banking services, integrated with a detailed focus on sales figures.

MD and CEO of the bank, Arun Shrivastava, stated that this is a flagship initiative that is aimed to provide best-in-class services to customers, while improving the four key functionalities of their operations, Digital Banking, HR Development, Business Process Re-engineering and Marketing.

items.title: Syndicate Bank Reports 5% Increase in Q2 Profit
items.body:
Syndicate Bank, a Manipal based public sector bank, reported a 5% increase in its net profit which was fixed at Rs 332 crore compared to Rs 316 crore profit last fiscal. The total income for Syndicate Bank rose to Rs 6,670 crore which was a 17. 4% increase. Various factors like lower provisions for non-performing assets and growth in net interest income.

Syndicate Bank offers a range of financial products like accounts, deposits and loan, and also facilities like internet banking for the benefit of their customers. Using the Syndicate Bank Net Banking facility, the customer can make a NEFT fund transfer by mentioning the IFSC code of beneficiary bank and the account number of beneficiary.

items.title: 300-500 New Branches on the Anvil for Syndicate Bank
items.body: One of India's oldest public sector banks, the Syndicate Bank, is keen to consolidate on its good name and social standing by expanding its already impressive presence across the country. Boasting a current branch count of over 3,500, the bank wants to establish 300-500 more branches through the next fiscal year. Speaking at a recent function, and commenting upon his bank's proposed additions to the Indian IFSC code system, Mr. TK Srivastava, Executive Director, expounded upon the bank's expansion plans including the proposed hiring of over 5,000 employees to affect this ambitious next step.

items.title: Syndicate Bank Launches 'SyndMahilaShakti'
items.body:
In a noble initiative directed towards women's empowerment, Syndicate Bank has launched 'SyndMahilaShakti', a unique movement which aims to extend financial assistance to over 20,000 women entrepreneurs across the country.

Under this special scheme, women entrepreneurs can avail loans up to Rs 5 crore at concessional interest rates. Interest rate for loans up to Rs 10 lakh is set at a base rate of 10.25 %, while for loans above Rs 10 lakh, a concession of 0.255 shall be provided on the base rate. Loans provided under this scheme shall not carry any processing or documentation charges. Also, borrowers needn't necessarily provide any collateral security or guarantee for loans up to Rs 10 lakh.

There are many other facilities which have been made available under the 'SyndMahilaShakti' scheme, some of which are instant global debit cards / ATM cards, credit cards which do not require any admission fees, SMS banking, mobile banking, money transfer with the help of IFSC code using internet banking, any branch banking, SyndSuraksha insurance policy and SyndArogya health insurance cover.

elements.body:
It is always a major hassle to lose your important documents. The same can be said for your vehicle documents like registration, license, insurance, etc. If you have lost your car insurance document, you need to replace it immediately to avoid the repercussions arising out of it. The insurance document must be produced when a law enforcement official asks for it. Also, if there is any claim during this period, you need your insurance details to file it with the company. Hence, replacing the insurance documents is extremely crucial. 

The good news is that it is not difficult to get a duplicate document from your insurer. Getting a duplicate document is also essential if your insurance document is fully or partially destroyed. You can get the duplicate document through the following process. 

File a police complaint

This is necessary only if you have lost your insurance document. If the document is destroyed, you may go ahead and contact the insurer directly. Filing a police complaint is essential before you visit the insurer to request for duplicate documents. Through this way, you can justify asking for duplicate documents. Also, an FIR from the police is required when speaking to relevant authorities regarding the loss of your insurance document. 

Place a newspaper advertisement

This is a formal procedure while applying for duplicate documents. You have to place a newspaper ad in a state newspaper to indicate your effort in getting back the document. You must bear the cost of placing the ad. If your insurance document is lost during transit, there is a chance of getting it back through this advertisement. If not, you can proceed with the next steps in the process. 

Contact the insurer

The insurer must be contacted immediately after losing your documents. The insurer may ask you to proceed with the above-mentioned steps before issuing the duplicate policy. You must also submit proofs like identity proof, address proof, policy number, etc., to the insurer while applying for a replacement. The insurer will verify the documents and issue the duplicate within a reasonable time. In exchange for this service, the insurer may charge a nominal fee from the policyholder. 

Indemnity bond

You must also execute an indemnity bond before getting a duplicate copy of the policy document from your insurer. The bond should have your full name along with the signatures of two witnesses. You may also have to pay the stamp fee for executing the bond. You can contact the insurance company regarding the formalities associated with executing an indemnity bond.

sections.title: Things to note

elements.body:
You must know the following things about your vehicle insurance document before applying for a duplicate one: 

  • In India, it is mandatory to have vehicle insurance (third-party). It is illegal to drive without valid insurance. Hence, it is necessary to apply for the duplicate as soon as possible. 
  • If you are worried about losing your documents, you can keep the original document in a safe place. In most states, law enforcement bodies accept photocopies of original insurance document. 
  • Nowadays, it is very common to have digital copies of your insurance documents. A recent amendment by the government has validated all digital documents including RC, license, insurance, etc. Digital copies of these documents can be stored in apps like DigiLocker or mParivahan and shown when required.

sections.title: Conclusion

elements.body: Having valid documents is essential when you drive your vehicle. Losing your documents can be a major hassle, but it is not impossible to recover these documents. Make sure that you follow the above-mentioned steps to get your duplicate insurance documents. Nowadays, it is possible to buy vehicle insurance online and renew it without going through any sort of paperwork. This way, you can easily have access to all your policy details without having any hard copies.

Possession certificate in Karnataka is issued by the Bangalore Development Authority. It is one of the most important documents that the buyer gives to the seller stating the date pf property possession. The certificate is also used to include the concerned property in the land revenue records.

Documents Required

sections.title: Steps to Apply for Possession Certificate in Karnataka

elements.body:
• Step 1: Visit the website Sakala Karnataka Official Site
  • Step 2: Click on the "Sakala Online Services" tab.
  • Step 3: Click on the "Bangalore Development Authority" tab.
  • Step 4: Alternatively, you can also visit the Bengaluru Development Authority website and go to "Services Under Sakala" section.
  • Step 5: Click on "Apply Online Possession Certificate Under SAKALA" as highlighted in the picture above.
  • Step 6: You will be redirected to "Seva Sindhu" portal (https://sevasindhu.karnataka.gov.in).
  • Step 7: Again, click on the "Bangalore Development Authority" tab and proceed to click on "Application for Possession Certificate for Sites" or "Application for Possession Certificate for Flats".
  • Step 8: Upon clicking, you will be able to check your eligibility and the documents required.
  • Step 9: Click "Apply Online". You will be asked to key in your registered mobile number and then click "Get OTP". You will get a one-time password. Enter the OTP along with the captcha code and hit the "Submit" button.
  • Step 10: You will also be required to upload all the mandatory documents. Upon completion of the process, your possession certificate will be issued.

sections.title: Offline Procedure

elements.body:
To apply offline, submit the application for possession certificate along with all the necessary documents to the concerned officer at the Deputy Secretary's Office. Ensure to get a note of acknowledgement. You won't be charged any fee for the application. It will take a maximum of 7 working days to process the application. You will then receive a notification to collect the possession certificate. You will be required to sign in a register as an acknowledgment of receiving the certificate.
